etymology.description: semantic: 泉 “spring” + semantic: 厂 “cliff” — a spring bursting from a cliff-side; ‘origin’.
etymology.interpretation: Combining “spring” and “cliff” evokes a water source emerging from a rock face, hence the idea of a beginning or source. By extension it broadened to senses like “original” and, in compounds such as 平原/高原, a level expanse or plain.

examples.chinese: 我想知道问题的原因(我想知道問題的原因)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xiǎng zhīdào wèntí de yuányīn.
examples.english: I want to know the cause of the problem.

examples.chinese: 这片平原很广阔(這片平原很廣闊)。
原来如此，谢谢你的解释(原來如此，謝謝你的解釋)。
examples.pinyin: Yuánlái rúcǐ, xièxie nǐ de jiěshì.
examples.english: So that’s how it is; thank you for the explanation.
